mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, George Washington to Marquis de Chastellux, 1785 September 5
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, George, 1732-1799
mdRecord.dcterms:description: George Washington begins this letter with a response to Chastellux’s previous flattery, he continues with his hopes for peaceful trade and poetically outlines how nations might accomplish such a noble task. Washington concluded with his plans for the Potomac Navigation Company, further identifying peaceful trade as a means of uniting nations. Autograph letter signed, 4 pages. Stamped with 'Archives de Chastellux.'
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Potomac Company
